definition: noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
the poor are ignored in the busiest city; the rich will find relatives in the deepest mountain
pinyin: qiong2 zai4 nao4 shi4 wu2 ren2 wen4 , fu4 zai4 shen1 shan1 you3 yuan3 qin1
containing_words.word: 窮在鬧市無人問，富在深山有遠親

sentences.english: Mr. Brown owns the amber anhydrates in the city belfry.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生領有鬧市區塔裏的棕色毛巾。

sentences.english: STEVE EMBER: The gardens offer peace in the middle of a busy city.
sentences.chinese: 這個橡樹園給繁忙的鬧市帶來一份平靜。

sentences.english: Home at the place far away from downtown area.
sentences.chinese: 把總部設在遠離鬧市區的地方。

sentences.english: All the world's a page at El Ateneo, a bookshop converted from an old theatre in downtown Buenos Aires.
sentences.chinese: 這是由布宜諾斯艾利斯鬧市一家老劇院改的豪華書店。

sentences.english: Not to loiter downtown in ice cream stores.
sentences.chinese: 不準在鬧市區的冰激凌店閒逛。
是玻璃幕牆高聳入雲的鬧市區？

sentences.english: He was raised on the mean streets of the central market district of Panama City.
sentences.chinese: 他從小在巴拿馬城中心鬧市區的窮街陋巷裏長大。

sentences.english: They are delinquents roaming the downtown streets.
sentences.chinese: 他們是在鬧市區閒逛的不良分子。

sentences.english: The successful experience of folding blasting cutting of a ten- storied building in downtown was introduced in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了鬧市區十層樓房定向爆破拆除成功經驗。

sentences.english: Mr Brown owns the brown  towels in the downtown tower.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生擁有鬧市區塔裏的棕色毛巾。

sentences.english: Habitat busy submarine, to enjoy a quiet alley door of poetic life.
sentences.chinese: 潛居鬧市，安享靜巷名門的詩意生活。

sentences.english: Along both banks of the river, there are the busiest sections downtown and green wooded mountains. That is Nanming District.
sentences.chinese: 河流兩旁繁華的鬧市和青翠的山嶺就是南明區。

sentences.english: High street stores will fail and close by the hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 鬧市區的商店將會成批的倒閉關門。

sentences.english: Located in the center of Causeway Bay, it is the most convenient hideaway from this hectic city.
sentences.chinese: 位於銅鑼灣的心臟地帶，是鬧市中偷閒的最好去處。

sentences.english: My favorite is this place downtown.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜歡的地方就是鬧市區。

sentences.english: The downtowns of all cities were lighted for Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 所有城市的鬧市區都爲聖誕張燈結綵。

definition: to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
Tuen Mun district of New Territories, Hong Kong
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
